runs.comm: a gentle full toss first ball. Swinging away, but too full, and Munaweera opens the face to guide it past point, and with with the wind. So four off first ball in international cricket
length ball now, outswinger, left alone
bowls the inswinger this time, but starts to straight, and hits him on the pad when headed down leg
outswinger. Nice shape, but starts going a little early. Munaweere watches it through to the keeper
slower offcutter, 108ks, on a length outside off, and Muna defends watchfully
wild swing and a miss. The dot balls showed here as he charged and backed away at the same time. Jarvis kept his line and bowled a full outswinger. Beats him just outside off
short of a length, outside off, punched nicely to point
full and wide, Dilshan drives, but doesn't hit it well
short of a length, angling away, Dilshan presses forward and punches this one the up. Between cover-point and cover. Into the wind. Still four all the way
half a shout for a catch at the wicket as Dilshan tries to pull this well down the leg side. Close to the glove, but called a wide. A big wide too
short of a length, on the pads, worked past short fine for a single
full, inswinger, beats him, but hits him on the pad when headed down leg
short, on leg, tries to pull, but is beaten by the pace
quick inswinger, 137.4ks, beats Dilshan both with the pace and the movement the other way. Appeals for lbw, but it is headed down leg
slower ball, 111ks, short of a length, turning in towards off, Dilshan gets a single off the bat and pad
bouncer, outside off, but it is too high, and is called both a wide and one for the over
full, on the pads, he has chipped this straight down the ground, almost bisecting mid-off and mid-on. Good timing takes it for four
lovely outswinger. Just short of a driving length, just outside off, then beats his drive
Munaweera is a thumper, he is all right. Another length ball, and he goes for a hit into the orbit. Not well timed at all, but it clears a valiant effort from Malcolm Waller running back from mid-on
backs away to hit, gets an inside edge onto the pad and DIlshan completes a quick single with a dive as the ball rolls towards point
short, angling towards just outside off, and he pulls all over it
gets the pull right this time, gets a single to deep square leg
effort ball, digs it in too short, and pays for it with a call of wide
slower ball, Dilshan gets a big leading edge as he tries to flick, and clears Brendan Taylor with ease. with the wind too. Dilshan gets away with one there
nice slower ball. Seams like a beamer to start off with, and then suddenly dips on him. Dilshan is not playing at it, and is lucky this is not in line with the stumps
big wide down the leg side this time
Uppish drive on the up. In the air for a bit too long, but goes right into the gap between cover and cover-point

swing this time, and Dilshan gets an inside edge onto the pad. They try to steal a single to point, and Munaweera is late to start, and gives up half way. However, the stumps are not hit. A possible run-out missed here
starts off with a short flat delivery, Dilshan rocks back, but is beaten on the pull. Headed down leg, so he is safe
punched off the back foot between cover and extra-cover. Top shot as it is played against a quickish delivery after a forward press
flighted now, and swept away to deep square leg for one
short delivery, turning down leg, a wide called
length ball, pitches leg, turns further down, another wide
makes room this time, and is cramped on the shot. Had he not backed away, he might just have got another wide
looks to sweep, misses, and gets a leg-bye to short fine leg
quick offbreak, Dilshan gets a soft leading edge towards for a single
short of a length, on off, punched wide of mid-off for a single

sitter dropped at deep midwicket by Malcolm Waller. That's one-and-a-half chances spilled by Waller now. Length ball, on the pads, flicked in the air, Waller at deep midwicket sets up for a low catch and spills it
The ramp shot. The scoop. We were expecting it Mr Dilshan. Length ball, pretty straight, and he is on a knee to clear short fine leg with ease
half-volley on off, and he off-drives it between the bowler and mid-off. No-fuss shot
short of a length, on off, punched to cover-point, and Munaweera would have been run out despite the dive had Zimbabwe hit direct. They miss the stumps again
low full towss on the pads, and easily glanced fine of short fine leg
misses out. Length ball, on the pads, but he finds short fine leg with the sweep
shorter now, and worked away for a single to deep square leg

an action-filled delivery. Muna tries to sweep a full and straight delivery, and just about manages to get bat on it. He takes off despite hitting it straight to short fine leg. Dilshan sends him back, and he loses his bat while turning back. And not having the bat in his hand has cost him a bit of reach and also his wicket
short of a length, MJ goes deep into the crease to defend this to straight midwicket
flighted outside off, and defended back to the bowler
full, on the pads, flicked away for a single to deep midwicket
full, on off, pushed towards the vacant midwicket region for one
short of a length, on leg, punched to wide long-on for one
short again, pulled to wide long-on again
full, on off, driven to long-off for one
the topspinner, and Mahela is expecting it to turn. Hit on the pad, and short fine leg is alert
full, on the pads, glanced away, but can't beat short fine leg
swept to short fine leg where Mpofu misfields to let them steal a single
reverse-sweep from Mahela, takes it from middle and leg, and beats backward point. What innivation
full, on the pads, worked away for a single
nicely played. Soft hands, and pushed wide of long-on, and comes back for an easy second
short, turning into the pads, pulled fine of deep square, and gets another couple
short of a length, turned away with soft hands towards deep square, but this time time they have to settle for just one
full, on off, driven to long-off for one
Mahela again has to make an adjustment as this one doesn't turn away. He bunts this nicely into the leg side, and Dilshan initiates a risky second, and makes it a with a big dive

Mahela has not been picking Cremer well. Again he plays for a legbreak, but this one keeps on coming with the arm. Full, on off, and Mahela plays outside the line. Hit flush in front, and is given out leg-before. Hang on. Hang on. They are checking the replay for a back-foot no-ball, and he has cut the side crease with the back foot. So that's a no-ball, and a free hit to follow. Poor bowlers
Mahela misses on a big heave-ho
chipped wide of long-off for a single

Cremer has come back well from that wicket off a no-ball with a quick delivery. Dilshan tries to cut it, there seems to be a noise, and Zimbabwe are pretty certain they have Dilshan caught at the wicket. The umpire takes his time before raising the wicket, and neither batsman looks happy with the decision
short, sliding away, cut away for a single
short of a length, on off, punched away wide of deep cover, comes back for an easy second
another punch from the back foot, gets a single to long-off
short of a length, doesn't turn as much as expected, hit back to the bowler
looks to cut, but is pitched on a length, and is way too full to play that shot. Beaten on the cut
shapes up to paddle a little too early, Utseya bowls it full and down leg. Even though it misses the leg stump, it's not called a wide
short, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
full toss, flicked away to deep midwicket for one
google, pitched outside leg, hits the leading edge as he tries to turn it to leg. Goes back to the bowler along the ground

that's a risky second. Cut away to deep point, and they pause a moment before starting the second. When they do decide to take it, they decide to take the second on the throw. The throw follows Jayawardene at non-striker's end, and he is out comfortably. That's Waller's throw. Some redemption for him
short of a length, cut away in front of square, gets a second easily
googly, starts full outside leg, turned around the corner for one
another googly, Mendis moves across, has no idea about it, but gets a single off the thick outside edge
beats him with a shortish delivery that angles in, and gets another dot in
fuller, outside off, gets the inside half of the bat for a single to long-on
length ball, outside off, driven wide of long-off, but not wide enough to come back for a second
length ball, angling in, drops and runs, and completes a comfortable single
full and wide, Sanga drives with an open face, places it wide of sweeper-cover. Craig Ervine makes a diving save, but can't prevent the third

full, on off, driven back at Mpofu, who gets a hand to it. The ball now travels much slower to long-on, but in the hurry to keep the batsmen down to one, both long-on and long-off misfield, and let it through for four. Vittori is the one who is done in by a wobble, and Utseya has overrun it. Gould is pretty amused as he signals four
slider, pushed wide of cover for one
Mendis has no clue about this googly, and is beaten comprehensively. It just misses the off stick
swept away for a single
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, but he manages to work it away for one
big winding sweep, and he has hit this really powerfully, and placed it wide of deep square leg
back-to-back fours for Mendis as he backs away and hits powerfully at this short delivery. He has placed it wide of long-off
length ball, on the pads, driven to long-on for one
full, on the pads, and he has flicked it for a flat six, and this is no mickey-mouse ground. Waller at deep square is well inside, and has been lobbed
tries the reverse-sweep off the quick man, gets some bat on it, but not enough to send it anywhere
slower ball, short, outside off, and he is beaten on the pull. Taylor does well to cover this ball bouncing well in front of him
poor poor bowling. Had Mendis not helped it along its way for four this would have been a big wide down the leg side
this time he successfully bowls a wide outside leg
yorker, on off, digs it out for one
length ball outside off, pushed with an open face, past cover point, and square of sweeper-cover
full, on off, wristily hit back, gets a single off the ricochet off Mpofu
short of a length, Sanga checks his shot, chips it down the ground for one
crisp hit to  a shortish ball outside off, but he finds extra cover with it
moves across to hit this full ball into the leg side. Mis-hits it for a single to wide long-on
no third man and he digs this one in short. Sanga backs away, and clears short third easily with his upper-cut
gives him the charge, hits this wide of deep square leg for a two
full, on off, inside edge into the pad, and then through for a single to short third man
makes room, drives a full delivery to sweeper-cover, gets a single. Jarvis staying full and straight here
how unfortunate is that. Lovely yorker, on leg, beats his bat, seems to have hit a foot hole, and then deviated away for four byes
misses the yorker, but errs on the fuller side, and concedes just a single to long-on
moves well across the stumps, but can't deviate Jarvis from his full and straight deliveries. Manages to get the bat down in time, and takes a single off the cue end
nice yorker, follows him too. Just the single to long-on. Runs straight down the pitch, and the umpire has a word with him
down the wicket, surprised by a full toss, gets a single to long-off
Sanga is down the wicket, Vittori bowls a low full toss, manages a hit to long-on. Mendis catches Sibanda by surprise, and takes the second
Sanga charges down and backs away, Vittori follows him, Sanga drives wide of sweeper-cover for two, but the relay throw from Masakadza is wild, and allows them the third
slower ball gone wrong, and is a wide down the leg side. Also a high full toss. So called a no-ball as a beamer
gets away with a slower-ball full toss, as Mendis hits it straight to fine leg for one
full, otuside off, Sanga has premeditated by backing away, and struggles to reach it. The mis-hit goes to Waller at deep cover, where a fumble allows them to come back for the second

slower ball, beats him, but as they steal a leg-bye, Jarvis lets go a wild throw for four overthrows. There was no way he was getting Sanga out. Zimbabwe - I don't believe I am saying this - have been ordinary in the field
top shot from Sanga. He first moves across, then backs away, finds he has got a half-volley on off, and drives it over point with an open face. Almost carries all the way for six
full toss, highish, the umpires might be interested in it. It's called a no-ball for a high full toss. Sanga gets a single to long-on
full, straight, driven to long-off for one. Oh wait. Another overthrow. This is ridiculous. Not a bad throw. Jarvis just fails to collect it
full, straight, flicked away, and midwicket dives over the ball, and they come back for another two
low full toss, flicked away, and Ervine makes a lovely diving save at square leg
full toss, swinging into him, cramps him up, concedes just the single to long-on
low full toss, just outside off, Sanga has backed away, and can't reach it properly. Gets a single to long-on
nice yorker as Mendis gives him the charge. Just the single conceded
that's a bit of toying around. Moves well across, gets inside the line of a full delivery, and flicks it over square leg for six
full and wide, hit to deep cover, and Sanga has run himself out trying a near-impossible second, but he was possibly taking a chance against sloppy what has been sloppy Zimbabwean fielding
and he has hit a six first ball. Length ball, into the pads, goes deep into the crease, and heaves it over square leg. Flat six. And again, let me remind you this is a huge playing field
low full toss, misses it, and they don't go through for a bye
